unnormalised: **Entertainment Buzz: Bollywood’s Box Office Bonanza (or Bust?)**
normalised: **Entertainment Buzz: Bollywood’s Box Office Bonanza (or Bust question mark)**

unnormalised: Mumbai – Bollywood saw a flurry of releases this Diwali season, and frankly, our chakkar is still spinning! Three biggies clashed: "Prem ki Pickle," a rom-com starring the ever-youthful Anil Kapoor; "Dhoom Machale Dhol," an action-comedy hoping to dethrone *Pathaan*; and "Saree Saga," a drama about, well, sarees. Critics are calling it "peak Bollywood" – for better or worse.
normalised: Mumbai – Bollywood saw a flurry of releases this Diwali season, and frankly, our chakkar is still spinning exclamation mark Three biggies clashed: "Prem ki Pickle," a rom-com starring the ever-youthful Anil Kapoor; "Dhoom Machale Dhol," an action-comedy hoping to dethrone *Pathaan*; and "Saree Saga," a drama about, well, sarees. Critics are calling it "peak Bollywood" – for better or worse.

unnormalised: "Prem ki Pickle," despite Anil Kapoor’s charm, reportedly made only Rs. 50 Crores in its opening weekend. Ouch! “Dhoom Machale Dhol," releasing at 09:00 hrs on 12/11/2024, seems to be doing better, riding on some truly ridiculous action sequences filmed, allegedly, entirely within a 5km radius of Film City.
normalised: "Prem ki Pickle," despite Anil Kapoor’s charm, reportedly made only rupee fifty crore in its opening weekend. Ouch exclamation mark “Dhoom Machale Dhol," releasing at zero nine hundred hours on twelfth november two thousand and twenty four, seems to be doing better, riding on some truly ridiculous action sequences filmed, allegedly, entirely within a five kilometer radius of Film City.

unnormalised: But the dark horse might be "Saree Saga." Early reviews are surprisingly positive, calling it a "masterpiece" (though, let's be honest, everything gets called a masterpiece these days). Let's see if it lasts more than 2 days in the cinema before being replaced by something else. Expect a full report by 17/11/2024. Meanwhile, happy movie-watching (and popcorn-chomping) folks! My bet? All three will be forgotten by Republic Day (26/01/2025).
